candidates.title: feat: subset type graph for JSR dependencies
candidates.body:
This is the first pass on adding a subset type graph for JSR dependencies. This type graph can then be provided to TypeScript instead of the original sources, causing very fast type checking and enabling the ability to distribute performant TypeScript as sources.

This is currently being called "fast check".

candidates.title: feat: include some possible dynamic imports with template literals in graph
candidates.body:
1. This does not have a directory entry limit.
2. This swallows errors.

Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno_graph/issues/275

candidates.title: refactor: switch to dep_analysis feature in deno_ast
fix: check bare node specifier for ImportMapError::UnmappedBareSpecifier
candidates.body:
This PR adds bare node specifier check when the `ResolveError` from `resolver.resolve` is `Other(ImportMapError::UnmappedBareSpecifier(_, _))`.

By this change, we can keep more detailed error message from `ImportMapError`, for example, like `Relative import path "unmapped" not prefixed with / or ./ or ../ and not in import map from "file://[WILDCARD]/092_import_map_unmapped_bare_specifier.ts"`

related https://github.com/denoland/deno/pull/20728

candidates.title: feat: deno specifier and workspace support
candidates.body:
This adds initial support for `deno:` specifiers and resolving deno specifiers to other workspace members.

The name of `deno:` specifiers is still TBD and same with the registry location.

candidates.title: chore: bump some deps we're bumping in deno
feat: ability to get public exports w/ dependent private types of specified entrypoints
candidates.body:
This is my personal code from https://github.com/dsherret/libpack/blob/1abd1292ff231ae3ea1015a46a4b7ca4c24305c6/rs_lib/src/dts/mod.rs

I think it would be usefulf or deno_doc in order to make it more advanced. I'm adding it here so both projects can share the same code.

Essentially what this does is provided some entrypoints, it will analyze all those entrypoints and return back all the public types along with their dependencies (cross file). This is useful for stuff like a dts declaration-based emit (which libpack does) and deno doc.

candidates.title: feat: store import sites on dependencies
candidates.body: Towards #228. Stops short of introducing `ImportError` / checking assertions because that's where it starts needing to be broken in. They're not included in the json yet since the schema needs a _little_ more scrutiny, but the serialization code is there to iterate on and is usable in the rust API.

candidates.title: fix: derive more traits on errors
feat: add npm specifiers to the graph
candidates.body:
We're going to rely on integration tests in the CLI for this atm (opened #241 for the future).

Closes #230

candidates.title: feat: add semver module
candidates.body:
This extracts out the semver module from the CLI

https://github.com/denoland/deno/tree/main/cli/semver

Although we could extract this out to another crate/repo, it's probably not worth it. I'm working on adding the npm code to deno_graph after this pr.
